translated: The Collection of Long Sayings .
The Questions of the Youth Puṇṇaka
“The one who is unshaken, who sees the root,
(thus said the venerable Puṇṇaka)
Has come to me with a question;
On what are the sages and humans dependent,
The nobles, brahmins, and gods;
The many sacrifices they have devised in the world,

original: Pucchāmi taṁ bhagavā brūhi me taṁ”.
analyzed: pucchāmi tam bhagavā brūhi me ta
translated: I ask you, Blessed One, please tell me that.”
“Those who are sages and humans,
(Puṇṇaka, said the Blessed One)

analyzed: khattiyāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ devatāna  puthu udha loke
translated: The nobles, brahmins, and gods;🔽The many sacrifices they have devised in the world,
Seeking to attain this human state,
They have devised sacrifices to escape old age.”
“Those who are sages and humans,
(thus said the venerable Puṇṇaka)
The nobles, brahmins, and gods;
The many sacrifices they have devised in the world,

analyzed: kaccissu te bhagavā yañña pathe appamattā
translated: Have they been heedful on the path of sacrifice, Blessed One?
Have they escaped birth and old age, dear Sir?

original: Pucchāmi taṁ bhagavā brūhi me taṁ”.
analyzed: pucchāmi tam bhagavā brūhi me ta
translated: I ask you, Blessed One, please tell me that.”
“They hope, they praise, they long for, they sacrifice,
(Puṇṇaka, said the Blessed One)
They are attached to gain through their aspirations for sensual pleasures;

analyzed: te yāja yogāḥ bhava rāga rattā
translated: They are bound by the fetters of sacrifice and attachment to sense pleasures,
They have not crossed beyond birth and old age, I say.”
“If they have not crossed beyond birth and old age,
(said the venerable Puṇṇaka)

original: Yaññehi jātiñca jarañca mārisa;🔽Atha ko carahi devamanussaloke,
analyzed: yaññehi jātiñca jarañca mārisa  atha kaḥ carahi deva manussa loke
translated: Through sacrifices, dear Sir, and birth and old age,
Then who has crossed beyond birth and old age, dear Sir,

original: Pucchāmi taṁ bhagavā brūhi me taṁ”.
analyzed: pucchāmi tam bhagavā brūhi me ta
translated: In the world of gods and men? I ask you, Blessed One, please tell me.”
“Having understood the higher and lower in the world,
(Puṇṇaka, said the Blessed One)
In whom there is no wavering anywhere in the world;
Peaceful, free from defilements, free from grief, free from despair,

analyzed: atāri saḥ jāti jaranti brūmi iti
translated: He has crossed beyond birth and old age, I say.”
The Questions of the Youth Puṇṇaka, the third.
